CA1847.shortDescription: Use char literal for a single character lookup
CA1847.fullDescription: 'string.Contains(char)' is available as a better performing overload for single char lookup.

CA1850.fullDescription: It is more efficient to use the static 'HashData' method over creating and managing a HashAlgorithm instance to call 'ComputeHash'.

CA1862.shortDescription: Use the 'StringComparison' method overloads to perform case-insensitive string comparisons
CA1862.fullDescription: Avoid calling 'ToLower', 'ToUpper', 'ToLowerInvariant' and 'ToUpperInvariant' to perform case-insensitive string comparisons because they lead to an allocation. Instead, prefer calling the method overloads of 'Contains', 'IndexOf' and 'StartsWith' that take a 'StringComparison' enum value to perform case-insensitive comparisons. Switching to using an overload that takes a 'StringComparison' might cause subtle changes in behavior, so it's important to conduct thorough testing after applying the suggestion. Additionally, if a culturally sensitive comparison is not required, consider using 'StringComparison.OrdinalIgnoreCase'.

CS8600.shortDescription: Converting null literal or possible null value to non-nullable type.

CS8602.shortDescription: Dereference of a possibly null reference.

CS8618.shortDescription: Non-nullable field must contain a non-null value when exiting constructor. Consider adding the 'required' modifier or declaring as nullable.

S1066.fullDescription: Nested code - blocks of code inside blocks of code - is eventually necessary, but increases complexity. This is why keeping the code as flat as possible, by avoiding unnecessary nesting, is considered a good practice.

S108.shortDescription: Nested blocks of code should not be left empty
S108.fullDescription: An empty code block is confusing. It will require some effort from maintainers to determine if it is intentional or indicates the implementation is incomplete.

S1104.shortDescription: Fields should not have public accessibility
S1104.fullDescription: Public fields in public classes do not respect the encapsulation principle and have three main disadvantages:

S1118.shortDescription: Utility classes should not have public constructors
S1118.fullDescription: Whenever there are portions of code that are duplicated and do not depend on the state of their container class, they can be centralized inside a "utility class". A utility class is a class that only has static members, hence it should not be instantiated.

S1192.shortDescription: String literals should not be duplicated
S1192.fullDescription: Duplicated string literals make the process of refactoring complex and error-prone, as any change would need to be propagated on all occurrences.

S1643.shortDescription: Strings should not be concatenated using '+' in a loop
S1643.fullDescription: Concatenating multiple string literals or strings using the + operator creates a new string object for each concatenation. This can lead to a large number of intermediate string objects and can be inefficient. The StringBuilder class is more efficient than string concatenation, especially when the operator is repeated over and over as in loops.

S2223.shortDescription: Non-constant static fields should not be visible
S2223.fullDescription: Unlike instance fields, which can only be accessed by code having a hold on the instance, static fields can be accessed by any code having visibility of the field and its type.

S3776.shortDescription: Cognitive Complexity of methods should not be too high
S3776.fullDescription: This rule raises an issue when the code cognitive complexity of a function is above a certain threshold.

SA0001.fullDescription: XML comment analysis can only be performed when the project is configured to parse documentation comments. To enable this functionality, update the project to produce an XML documentation file as part of the build.

SA1009.shortDescription: Closing parenthesis should be spaced correctly
SA1009.fullDescription: A closing parenthesis within a C# statement is not spaced correctly.

SA1111.shortDescription: Closing parenthesis should be on line of last parameter
SA1111.fullDescription: The closing parenthesis or bracket in a call to or declaration of a C# method/indexer/attribute/array/constructor/delegate is not placed on the same line as the last parameter.

SA1117.shortDescription: Parameters should be on same line or separate lines
SA1117.fullDescription: The parameters to a C# method or indexer call or declaration are not all on the same line or each on a separate line.

SA1122.fullDescription: The C# code includes an empty string, written as "".

SA1202.shortDescription: Elements should be ordered by access
SA1202.fullDescription: An element within a C# code file is out of order in relation to other elements in the code.

SA1300.shortDescription: Element should begin with upper-case letter
SA1300.fullDescription: The name of a C# element does not begin with an upper-case letter.

SA1307.shortDescription: Accessible fields should begin with upper-case letter
SA1307.fullDescription: The name of a public or internal field in C# does not begin with an upper-case letter.

SA1400.fullDescription: The access modifier for a C# element has not been explicitly defined.

SA1401.fullDescription: A field within a C# class has an access modifier other than private.

SA1501.shortDescription: Statement should not be on a single line
SA1501.fullDescription: A C# statement containing opening and closing braces is written completely on a single line.

SA1503.fullDescription: The opening and closing braces for a C# statement have been omitted.

SA1507.shortDescription: Code should not contain multiple blank lines in a row
SA1507.fullDescription: The C# code contains multiple blank lines in a row.

SA1518.shortDescription: Use line endings correctly at end of file
SA1518.fullDescription: File is required to end with a single newline character

SA1633.fullDescription: A C# code file is missing a standard file header.
